alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 10:33PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Hunterdon and Mercer. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen at some locations. An addition 0.5 to 1 inch of rain is possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Ewing, Doylestown, Byram, Pennington, New Hope, Yardley, Newtown, Hopewell, Stockton, and Washington Crossing. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 68 and 76. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
